properties.address: Highwood, Chelmsford CM1 3QJ, UK
properties.description: Warm Space, Monday to Friday 09.00 - 17.00 Free for everyone. All welcome. Throughout the year, we offer a warm welcome. This Winter, with rising living costs resulting in many people worried about keeping their homes heated, we are offering a Warm Space for everyone in the foyer at Highwood Village Hall. Come along and enjoy refreshments, books and board games, bathe in the warmth of other members of our communities and relax in a warm and comfortable environment. Whether you want to quietly read a book, the papers or knit and natter, families and individuals, young and older, are all most welcome to share our Warm Space this Winter.
properties.title: Highwood Village Hall – Warm Spaces

properties.address: Galleywood Rd, Chelmsford CM2 8BS, UK
properties.description: We offer fully funded volunteer trips to Moldova for young people 13-18 years three times a year in the school holidays. Young people can apply vis email, or our website for an application form. They are then invited for an interview to get to know them and successful candidates are then chosen. We believe volunteering should have no barriers. We provide aid to Moldova working closely with our partners delivering our Educational project of Rucksacks and schools supplies as well as clothes and shoes to the poorest rural communities ensuring all children have access to an Education. We provide food parcels and household goods where necessary. We have partnered with the Phoenix Centre in Riscani a Centre for disabled children and we are passionate about access for all children to Education so we provide wheelchairs and buggies. Our volunteers help out in the centre as part of their volunteer experience. We have a community shoebox programme hand delivering one thousand boxes and Christmas bags to the poorest communities of Romania and now Moldova. We work closely with Essex schools, youth club, scouts, cubs special needs colleges and elderly centres to reach all sectors of the community as well as local businesses. This is Essex working together so that Children may receive a box of warm clothing , educational supplies , toys and toiletries. More importantly the children know that someone cares. We are a full time charity run entirely by volunteers.
properties.title: Little Edi Foundation

properties.address: Little Waltham, Chelmsford CM3 3FE, UK
properties.description: Abberton Rural Training (ART) are an award winning charity providing rural skills education and training including mental health counselling and advocacy support. We have specialist groups for all types of people including SEND, Wounded and Injured Service Personnel & Veteran, domestic Violence Victims, ethnic minorities & refugees, adults struggling with mental health, NEETS, Youth offenders and general adult groups. We work across Essex with 13 sites available and have short and long term courses and support options. We use nature and the environment as the basis including horticulture, countryside & environment, woodlands, land based studies, construction, carpentry, textiles and rural crafts all using recycled materials. We also work with councils and other partners with community gardens and schools projects. We also provide holiday activities for children in gardening and rural crafts for age 5+ with SEN and FSM.   We are a Warm Space.
properties.title: Abberton Rural Training

properties.address: The Grove Centre, Witham CM8 2YT, UK
properties.description: Based in Witham, Essex we welcome anyone who wishes to join us to pop by to access our various clubs, groups, use our cafe, hire our meeting rooms or sit in our warm spaces. The Witham Hub is the home of the Witham Community Fridge which supports those in food poverty but also prevent good food from going to landfill so is open to all to use Most of our activities are free but if we do charge we keep our costs as low as possible to give everyone the chance to take part All are welcome at the Hub
properties.title: The Witham Hub

properties.description: Hanna's Field Charity is a voluntary group who run the hall and field. Presently running a village warm hub on Sunday afternoons from 2.00 to 4.00. Free refreshments to all comers, a chance to chat with neighbours, select books, watch DVDs and keep warm, both physically and socially. Indivduals and Families welcome, can offer craft and play activites, reading corner and more if customers want it. In the Village Hall in East Hanningfield CM3 8AE Close to West and South Hanningfield, Bicknacre, Rettendon Common and Howe Green.

properties.description: We will be running a new free programme this year called Winter Shield. We will be bringing freshly cooked and healthy homemade meals to the local neighbourhoods as well as a variety of sporting activities. In these pop-up clubs, young people will be able to enjoy good, nutritious meals, play sports and games, as well as hang out with old friends, and make some new ones. The programme will run from the 1st November 2022 to the 31st March 2023.

properties.description: Hot drinks, bring a board game, grab a book from the Book Nook   Every Friday from October 21st 2022 onwards the centre's main hall (The Chase) will be open to all between 1 & 5pm. Come to your community drop in. Get to know your neighbourhood or perhaps find a quiet corner with a book for the Book Nook. Grab a cuppa, bring a board game, stay for five minutes or hours - it's up to you. (Room hire and heating being donated by Beaulieu Community Trust in conjunction with the Warm Bank countrywide scheme) We are a Warm Space
properties.title: Beaulieu Community Centre

properties.address: Rettendon Common, Chelmsford CM3 8DP, UK
properties.description: The hall is open on every Wednesday until April, from 11am till 2pm, offering a warm space, company, food and drink free to the Parish of Rettendon which includes the village of Rettendon, Rettendon Common area and Battlesbridge. There are games, books, jigsaws and crafts available. The hall is available for hire at other times and is already used by the Rettendon Horticultural Society, Parish Council, dance classes, bowls and craft groups.
properties.title: Rettendon Memorial Parish Hall

properties.description: Growbaby is an outreach compassion project aimed at ensuring babies and children under 5 in our local communities have everything they need FREE for their early years of life. We recognise that the financial impact of having a baby can be huge and we try to ease the strain for local families by offering all our new/2nd hand items entirely free of charge! Baby clothes, Moses’ baskets, car seats, buggies, emergency nappies & milk are all available.
properties.title: GrowBaby Rayleigh

properties.address: High St, Billericay CM12 9BQ, UK
properties.description: Baby Basics provides essential items needed for life with a new baby to vulnerable families. All clients are referred to us by frontline care professionals. Each item given away is donated by people like you.
properties.title: Baby Basics Billericay

properties.address: Market Hill, Maldon CM9 4PZ, UK
properties.description: Community in a Cup is a joint project between Longfield Medical Centre and Maldon United Reformed Church (URC) offering help, information, fun and relaxing craft activities, free refreshments, a warm welcome and a listening ear. It is a monthly, drop-in information hub on the last Tuesday of the month at the Maldon URC. There is specialist help and advice available from organisations including Alzheimer’s Society, United in Kind, Ace Music Therapy, Tesco, Community Agents, Essex County Fire & Rescue, Action for Family Carers, Parkinson’s, MacMillan, and U3A. Dates for 2023 are: - Tuesday 31 January 10am-12pm - Tuesday 28 February 10am-12pm - Tuesday 28 March 10am-12pm - Tuesday 25 April 10am-12pm Come along and find out how to keep warm and well. All are welcome.
properties.title: Community in a Cup

properties.address: 27 Fullbridge
properties.description: A drop-in hub on Tuesdays, 9.30am-1pm at Fullbridge Church, Maldon. All are welcome. Come along for FREE refreshments and a light lunch. Get information, advice and support from local organisations including Job Club, Citizen’s Advice, and Maldon and District CVS. It also offers support for Ukrainian refugees and their host families.
properties.title: Fullbridge Church Community Hub

properties.address: Melbourne Ave, Chelmsford CM1 2DT, UK
properties.description: Open Door Community Café is a warm space which is open every Thursday morning from 8.30 am - 11.30 am We offer good quality tea/coffee, homemade cakes, soup and toast in a warm. friendly and welcoming environment. The café is open to everyone and caters for people of all ages.
properties.title: St Andrew’s Church Chelmsford

properties.address: Maldon CM9 6GG, UK
properties.description: Chatty Café - A Morrisons checkout operator is helping to combat loneliness by running a ‘chatty café’ at the store in Limebrook Way, Maldon, every Wednesday from 10am until 11am. If you would like to take part in one of Lisa’s Chatty Café sessions at the Morrisons Café, just turn up next Wednesday at 10am.
properties.title: Chatty Cafe at Morrisons (Maldon)

properties.address: Chelmsford CM1 1LN, UK
properties.description: Coffee Central, 10am-12pm Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays.

properties.address: The Green, Sandon, Chelmsford CM2 7SH, UK
properties.description: Every third Friday of the month we hold a free coffee morning here @ The Crown Sandon in aid of Mental Health 10am-12pm. Free coffee and cake, everyone is welcome. There is always a friendly ear to listen or a quiet corner free, what ever you need we are here to help each other.
properties.title: Coffee Morning at The Crown, Sandon

properties.address: Beardsley Dr, Springfield, Chelmsford CM1 6GQ, UK
properties.description: At St Augustine of Canterbury, North Springfield a Craft and Chat session is held once a month where people are invited to come along, share crafts, do knitting etc and maybe just chat. There is always tea/coffee and usually a cake. A £1 donation is asked for to cover this. For further information, please contact the church direct.
properties.title: Craft and Chat at St Augustine Church, Springfield

properties.address: The Tye, East Hanningfield, Chelmsford CM3 8AE, UK
properties.description: East Hanningfield has organised a Warm Village Hub at the Village Hall where any resident of the village can meet and socialise every Sunday afternoon during the winter (excluding the Christmas and New Year weekend). Volunteers will serve free tea/coffee/squash and cakes. There are books to borrow and a large TV plays children friendly films.
properties.title: East Hanningfield Village Hall

properties.address: Springfield Park Rd, Chelmsford CM2 6EB, UK
properties.description: There is a free vegetarian meal provided every Thursday at Springfield Baptist Church, Chelmsford at 5.30pm. It's completely free and anyone can come. There's no need to let us know, just turn up. If guests do not want to eat at the church we can provide a takeaway. Tea and coffee is served too. It's a lovely atmosphere and warm too. The food that FoodCycle use is given by local supermarkets. From this a two course meal. is prepared Sometimes there is surplus left over ie: bread and cakes and the guests can take this home. Again, free of charge.
properties.title: FoodCycle (Chelmsford)

Starting every Tuesday from 8th November 10.30am - 12.30pm (term time)
properties.title: Ladies Coffee Morning

properties.address: Tydemans, Great Baddow, Chelmsford CM2 9FH, UK
properties.description: Are you a keen knitter? Or have you always wanted to learn how? We are welcoming volunteers to join a new ladies' only knitting group at Hamptons Sport & Leisure Centre in Great Baddow. The group includes experienced knitters, complete beginners, refugees, older people, and ladies who've dealt with difficult circumstances or sad times. Over lots of coffee and cake we chat, create, laugh, and make things for good causes! Bring your own projects, or join us in making items for local causes. The group meets on the second and fourth Monday of each month, 10am to 12noon.
properties.title: Ladies Knitting Group
